required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Dentifrice Usage Regime on Delivery and Efficacy of Fluoride
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Measure the Effect of Dentifrice Usage Regime on Delivery and Efficacy of Fluoride Using an In Situ Caries Model

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate and compare the effect of the amount of toothpaste used and brushing time on enamel strengthening (percent of surface microhardness recovery, % SMHR) and enamel fluoride uptake (EFU).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Surface Micro Hardness Recovery (% SMH), of Brushing for 2 Minutes Versus (vs.) Brushing for 45 Seconds With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
primary_outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (micrometer [μm]) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Surface Micro Hardness (% SMH) Recovery , of Brushing for 2 Minutes vs. Brushing for 45 Seconds With 0.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (μm) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Surface Micro Hardness (% SMH) Recovery, of Brushing for 2 Minutes With 0.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (μm) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Surface Micro-hardness Recovery (% SMH), of Brushing for 45 Seconds With 0.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 45 Seconds With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (μm) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Surface Micro-hardness (% SMH) Recovery, of Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of an Control Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (μm) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU) After Brushing for 2 Minutes vs. Brushing for 45 Seconds With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU) After Brushing for 2 Minutes vs. Brushing for 45 Seconds With 0.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
secondary_outcome.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.

secondary_outcome.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.

arm_group.description: Participants brush twice a daily for 45 seconds with experimental dentifrice.
Participants brush twice a daily for 45 seconds with experimental dentifrice.
Participants brush twice a daily for 2 minutes with experimental dentifrice.
Participants brush twice a daily for 2 minutes with experimental dentifrice.
Participants brush twice a daily for 2 minutes with controll dentifrice.

intervention.description: Dentifrice containing 1150 parts per million (ppm) fluoride as sodium fluoride / silica and 0.4% carbopol
Dentifrice containing 1150 ppm fluoride as sodium fluoride / silica and 0.4% carbopol
Dentifrice containing 250 ppm fluoride as sodium fluoride / silica and 0.4% carbopol
A non fluoride dentifrice was given to participants of each arm at washout period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
General and Dental Health
- Good general and dental health with (in the opinion of the investigator) no clinically significant and relevant abnormalities of medical history or oral examination
- Have no current active caries or periodontal disease that may compromise the study or the health of the subjects
- Residency: Currently living in the Indianapolis, Indiana area
Dentures:
- Currently wearing a removable mandibular partial denture with sufficient room in the posterior buccal flange area to accommodate two enamel specimens (required dimensions 12 mm x 7 mm)
- Willing to have their denture modified to accommodate enamel test specimens and willing and capable of wearing their removable mandibular partial dentures 24 hours per day during the experimental periods
- All restorations in a good state of repair
- Salivary Flow: Have a salivary flow rate in the range of normal values (unstimulated whole saliva flow rate ≥ 0.2 mL/minute; gum base stimulated whole saliva flow rate ≥ 0.8 mL/minute)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Antibiotics: Use of antibiotics two weeks prior to a treatment visit or anticipated use during the study treatment periods
- Study Scale Use: Subjects unable to measure product weights accurately using the assigned study scale as determined by the study staff (as demonstrated on or before Visit 4)
- A member of the site study staff who is directly working on the project or living in that staff's household
- Any employee of any toothpaste manufacturer or their spouse or family member

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 1 center in the USA.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total of 74 participants were screened for the study, out of which 65 participants were randomized in the study. Nine participants were screen failures.

group.title: Overall
group.description: This was a five arm cross-over study. Five arms were divided according to the different treatment regimens, the participants were received all the following treatment regimens during the study: 1. Experimental dentifrice 0.5 grams (g) for 45 seconds, 2. Experimental dentifrice 0.5g for 2 minutes, 3. Experimental dentifrice 1.5g for 45 seconds, 4. Experimental dentifrice 1.5g for 2 minutes, and 5. Control dentifrice 1.5g for 2 minutes only.

baseline.population: Safety population: The overall Safety Population included all the participants who were randomized and used at least one of the treatment dentifrices during the study and had at least one safety assessment (e.g. assessment of adverse events [AEs] or had an oral soft tissue examination) after using the treatment dentifrices.

group.title: Overall
group.description: This was a five arm cross-over study. Five arms were divided according to the different treatment regimens, the participants were received all the following treatment regimens during the study: 1. Experimental dentifrice 0.5 grams (g) for 45 seconds, 2. Experimental dentifrice 0.5g for 2 minutes, 3. Experimental dentifrice 1.5g for 45 seconds, 4. Experimental dentifrice 1.5g for 2 minutes, and 5. Control dentifrice 1.5g for 2 minutes only.

outcome.title: Percentage Surface Micro Hardness Recovery (% SMH), of Brushing for 2 Minutes Versus (vs.) Brushing for 45 Seconds With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
outcome.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (micrometer [μm]) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.
outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) population: Included all randomized participants who had no major protocol deviations that were felt by the investigator to have affected the assessment of efficacy for all treatments.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 2 Minutes Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 45 Seconds Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 45 seconds with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

measure.population: Per Protocol (PP) population: Included all randomized participants who had no major protocol deviations that were felt by the investigator to have affected the assessment of efficacy for all treatments.

analysis.p_value_desc: Between Treatment p-Values based on the statistical model adjusting for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect).
analysis.estimate_desc: LS Mean from Analysis of variance (ANOVA) with factors for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect). Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favours the first named treatment.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 2 Minutes Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Contol Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of control dentifrice.

measure.title: Percent Surface Micro-hardness (% SMH) Recovery, of Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of an Control Dentifrice.
measure.description: SMH recovery test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMH recovery was performed in-vitro and determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents re-hardening of enamel surface. % SMH recovery was calculated from indentation length (μm) of sound enamel specimen at baseline (B), indentation length (μm) after in vitro demineralization (D1), indentation length (μm) after intra-oral exposure (R): [D1-R/D1-B] ×100.

analysis.p_value_desc: Between Treatment p-Values based on the statistical model adjusting for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect).
analysis.estimate_desc: LS Mean from ANOVA with factors for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect). Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favours the first named treatment.

outcome.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU) After Brushing for 2 Minutes vs. Brushing for 45 Seconds With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice.
outcome.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.
outcome.population: PP population included all randomized participants who had no major protocol deviations that were felt by the investigator to have affected the assessment of efficacy for all treatments.

analysis.estimate_desc: LS Mean from ANOVA with factors for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect). Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favours the first named treatment.

outcome.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU) After Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Control Dentifrice.
outcome.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.
outcome.population: PP population included all randomized participants who had no major protocol deviations that were felt by the investigator to have affected the assessment of efficacy for all treatments.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 2 Minutes Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Contol Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of control dentifrice.

measure.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU) After Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Experimental Dentifrice vs. Brushing for 2 Minutes With 1.5g of Control Dentifrice.
measure.description: EFU was measured by using micro-drill analysis of the enamel specimens carried out after 14 days of intra-oral exposure for each of the toothpaste treatments. The amount of fluoride-uptake by enamel was calculated based on the amount of fluoride divided by the area of the enamel cores.
measure.population: PP population included all randomized participants who had no major protocol deviations that were felt by the investigator to have affected the assessment of efficacy for all treatments.

analysis.p_value_desc: Between Treatment p-Values based on the statistical model adjusting for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect).
analysis.estimate_desc: LS Mean from ANOVA with factors for treatment, study period, and participant (random effect). Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a positive difference favours the first named treatment.

reported_events.desc: All non-oral Adverse events (AEs) were not coded, therefore all the non-oral AEs were reported under system order class (SOC) General disorder.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 0.5g, 45 Seconds Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 45 seconds with 0.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 0.5g, 2 Minutes Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 0.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 45 Seconds Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 45 seconds with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Experimental Dentifrice 1.5g, 2 Minutes Brushing Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with 1.5g dose of experimental dentifrice.

group.title: Contol Group
group.description: Participants in this arm brushed their teeth twice a daily (morning and evening) for 2 minutes with control dentifrice.

event.sub_title: Gingival mucosa imprint from teeth 28 and 29

Swelling of right inside of mouth & lip caused by biting

Gingival mucosa erythema left posterior edentulous ridge
Sore area on ridge area #22 from partial
Submandibular area small ulcer not painful
Labial mucosa chapped lips upper & lower
Broke right hip (right intertrochanteric hip fracture)
Left eye swollen and red beneath eye

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
